pr_title: DHFPROD-4349: Middle-tier work to reject bad path input

timeline.bodyHTML:
I recommend including the directory path in here for more context - e.g.

throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid project directory: " + directory);

I also try to avoid IOException whenever possible, as it's a checked exception. For almost all IO errors, it's unlikely that a client can do anything meaningful with it other than rethrow it.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.body:
Oh okay - IOException is being used as way of indicating that the project directory is unavailable. I think IOException is too broad for that - I can definitely see some other feature in the future throwing an IOException that has nothing to do with the project directory.

I recommend creating an e.g. "ProjectDirectoryException" and catching any possible IOException from the code that tries to access the project directory. This code can then catch that exception without any concern that something else may throw the exception.
